intro: Maesa pipericarpa, commonly known as the pepperleaf maesa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
